title: Srimad Bhagavad-gita - Chapter 10 Recitation | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | ISKCON Bangalore Sanga
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: dadhāmi buddhi yogam tam yena mām upayanti te
segments.summary: The speaker recites verses from the Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 10, focusing on the opulence of the Absolute Self and the path to reach Him.
segments.transcript: Bhagavad Gita, Chapter 10, The Opulence of the Absolute Self: bhavanti bhāvā bhūtānā matta eva praghaṁ vidhāḥ mahārshayas saptapūrvē chattvāro manavasthatā madhbhāvā mānasājātā yeṣyāṁ lokayi mah prajāḥ etāmbibhūtim yogam ca mamayo vetti tattvatah sobhi kalpena yogena yujjate nātra saṁśayā āṁ sarvasya prabhavo vattas sarvam pravartate piti madhvā bhajante mām budhā bhāva samantvitāḥ madhchitta madhgata prāṇā bodhayantah parasvaram kathayantas ca mām nityam tuṣyanti ca ramanthi ca teṣāṁ satata yuktānāṁ bhajatāṁ prīti pūrvakam dadhāmi buddhi yogam tam yena mām upayanti te teṣāṁ evānukam pārtham ahaṁ ajñāna-jam tam ahaṁ nāśayāṁ yātma bhāvastho jñāna-dīpena bhāsvatā

segments.summary: The speaker continues reciting verses, including Arjuna's inquiry about Krishna's divine opulences and Krishna's promise to reveal them.
segments.transcript: arjuna vāca parambrahma paramdhāma pavitraṁ paramambhavān puruṣaṁ śāśvatam divyaṁ ādi devam ajambibham āhus tvāmṛśayasarve devaṁ śirnāra dastatha asito deva lovyāsa svayam caiva prabhīṣime sarvam etad vṛtam manye yanmām adasikeṣava nahite bhagavan vyaktim vidur devāna dānavāha svayam evātman ātmānam ved-khatvam puruṣottama bhūtabhāvana bhūteṣā deva deva jagatpate bhaktum arhasyasyeṣena divyārhyātma vibhūtayaha yādhir vibhūti virlokāni māṁ stvam yāpya tiṣṭhasī katham vidyām ahaṁ yogiṁ stvāṁ sada pari-cintayan keṣu keṣu ca bhāveṣu cintyosi bhagavan mayā vistaren ātmano yogam vibhūtiṁ ca janārdhanā bhūyā kathayatra ptirhīṣuṁ vato nāsthi me mṛtam śrī bhagavān uvāca hantate katha iṣyāmi divyāhyātma vibhūtayah prādhānyata kuruṣeṣṭhā nāsthyanto vistarasya me

segments.summary: Krishna begins to describe His opulences, identifying Himself as the source and essence of various aspects of creation.
segments.transcript: ahaṁ ātmā gudākeṣa sarva bhūtāśayasya sthitaḥ ahaṁ ādis ca madhyam ca bhūtā nāmanta eva ca ādiktyānām ahaṁ viṣṇur jyoti-śāvraviraṁ śumān marī-chirmarudāmasmi lakṣakrāṇām ahaṁ śaśi vedānāṁ sāma-vedoṣmi devānāmasmi vāsa-mahā indriyānāṁ manas-chāsmi bhūtānāmasmi cetanā rudrānāṁ śaṅkaras-chāsmi viddeṣo yakṣa-rakṣa-sāṁ vasūnāṁ pāvakas-chāsmi meruṣhi-kharināmaḥ urodhasāṁ ca mukhyam vāṁ viddhi-pārtha-vṛhaspatim senā-nīnāmaḥ skandhasara-sāmasmi sāgaraḥ mahārishīnāṁ rūgurāṁ ghirāmasmi ekam aksharam yajñānāṁ japa-yajñoṣmi sthāvarānāṁ imālayah aśvattha-sarva-vṛkṣānāṁ devarṣīnāṁ ca nāradah gandharvānāṁ citraratha-siddhānāṁ kapilo muniḥ ucchaiśrava-samashvānāṁ viddhi-mām amṛtodbhavam airāvatanga-jaindrānāṁ narānāṁ ca nalādhipam āyudhānāṁ aham vajraṁ denu nāmasmi kāmadu prajanaschāsmi kandharpa-sarpā-nāmasmi vāsukihi anantaschāsmi nāgānāṁ varuṇo yādusāmaḥ vitrnāmaryamāchāsmi yamasamyamatāmaḥ prahlādaschāsmi daityānāṁ kālakahayatāmaḥ mṛgānāṁ ca mṛgendroḥam vainateyascha-pakṣināṁ pavanaḥ pavatāmasmi rāmasyaśtra-bṛtāmaḥ yashānāṁ vakaraschāsmi śrotasāmasmi jānlavi

segments.summary: The recitation continues with Krishna elaborating on His presence in different forms and concluding that only a fragment of His power sustains the universe.
segments.transcript: sargānāṁ ādirantascha-vadhyam chaivāham arjunaḥ adhyātma-vidyā-vidyānāṁ vānaḥ prabhadatāmaḥ aksharānāṁ akārosmi vandasāmaḥ sikasya ca ahaṁ evākṣayakkālo dhātāham viśvatau mukahaḥ vṛtyuḥ sarmaḥ haraschāham urdhva-vascha-bhaviśyatām kīrtis-śrīrvākṣa-nārināṁ smṛtir-medhā-dṛtyakṣamāḥ vṛyat-sāmat-tathā-sāmnām rāyat-trī-candra-sāmaḥ māsānāṁ mārga-śeṣyoham hṛto nāmpu-sumākaraḥ dyutam-chalayatāmasmi tejas-tejasmi nāmaḥ jayosmi vyavasāyosmi sattvaṁ sattva-vatāmaḥ viṣṇināṁ vāsudevosmi pāṇḍavānāṁ dhananjayaḥ munīnāṁ apyaḥ vyāsaḥ kavīnāṁ uṣaṇāṁ kavihiḥ dandodamayatāmasmi nītirasmi jihīśyatāṁ maunam chaivasmi guhyānāṁ jānam jānava-tāmaḥ yacchāpi sarva-bhūtānāṁ vīcam tadaham arjunaḥ natalasti vināyatsyāṁ mayā bhūtam ca rācaram nāntostimam adivyānāṁ vibhūtīnāṁ parantapaḥ eṣa-truṭeṣa-taḥ prokto vibhūten viṣṭa-romayāṁ yad-yad-vibhūti mad-sattvaṁ śrī-mad-ūrjita-mīvavaḥ tatta-devā-vagacchattvaṁ mavate-jaṁśa-sambhavaṁ atavā-vahu naitena kimñātena-tavārjunaḥ viṣṭa-vyāha-mīdam kṛṣṇaṁ ekāṁ śena-sthito jagat
